update.description:
Use consolas as the small monospaced font on Windows rather than Ubuntu.

Qt's font rendering on windows'seems to be more variable, and at least on Windows 7,
the Ubuntu font at smaller sizes looks absolutely horrendous. On Windows 10
it is a little better, but still with Qt and whatever settings I have, there
doesn't seem to be any sub-pixel smoothing.

Consolas is wider at the same height and so more forgiving of bad font rendering.
It should be present on all Windows 7 and Windows 10 computers.

This was pointed out by Phil in the pull request that changed the font to be Ubuntu mono, but I didn't see how bad it could get until I deployed it to a lab computer. So, point taken. Is this any better do you think @{philipstarkey}?

It looks like windows *can* be better, but often isn't, and people shouldn't have to change their font rendering settings just to be able to read globals values without squinting.
update.title: Use consolas as the small monospaced font on Windows rather than Ubuntu.

content.raw: Tested this in the lab on Win7 and it looks pretty good IMHO. Will merge on Monday if there are no comments.

pull_request.title: Use consolas as the small monospaced font on Windows rather than Ubuntu.

pullrequest.title: Use consolas as the small monospaced font on Windows rather than Ubuntu.

content.raw: If anyone is experimenting, the other obvious choice is Lucida Console. If you change it to that on line 88, it might be better or it might be worse. I will investigate in the lab with the Windows 7 computer where it looked the worst. Consolas and Lucida Console look pretty similar on my Win10 virtualbox, but from what I've read [they are optimised for different kinds of font rendering](https://blog.codinghorror.com/consolas-and-cleartype/) so could be pretty different on some setups.
content.html: If anyone is experimenting, the other obvious choice is Lucida Console. If you change it to that on line 88, it might be better or it might be worse. I will investigate in the lab with the Windows 7 computer where it looked the worst. Consolas and Lucida Console look pretty similar on my Win10 virtualbox, but from what I've read they are optimised for different kinds of font rendering so could be pretty different on some setups.
